fields.description:
Step 1:  I'm developing a servlet that gets triggered by a webhook.  Running the JIRA plugin in the fast-dev environment on my local machine is fine, all works.

Step 2: When deploying the jar file as a plugin to a production server I get the following error "2013-12-11 17:34:35,693 httpclient-callbacks:thread-2 WARN anonymous     [atlassian.webhooks.plugin.PublishTaskFactoryImpl$PublishTaskImpl] Server error - 500 when posting to web hook at 'http://localhost:8081/plugins/servlet/vinnustund?issue=DEMO-27&action=%27insert%27&user_id=vilhjalmurh'"

Step 3: I installed another standalone JIRA instance on my local machine and repeated the deployment in step 2 and I get the same error. ergo The plugin only runs in the fast-dev environment.

Does anyone have any ideas why this is?
fields.summary: Server error - 500 A servlet plugin runs fine in fast-dev but not on production instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36167].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Required fields are not set when Issue Type is changed by an Inline Edit.


h3. Environment
* 5.2.11, 6.0.8, 6.1.5, 6.2.4, 7.1-OD-01 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Take a standard JIRA installation and add a field, e.g. "Detection Phase", to Bug issue type. Make the field required in the field configuration.
# Create an issue of some other type.
# Change the type to Bug via inline edit.
# Result: The required field has no value.

h3. Expected Results
Required fields are propmted to be updated

h3. Actual Results
Issue type can be changed via inline edit and required fields are not populated.
Another example: Changing an issue type to Epic via inline edit does not require an "Epic Name" to be set
 
h3.Workaround
- Use the *More* > *Move* Function to change the issue type

h3. Note

That the same issue occurs when an issue type is changed via the *Edit Issue* screen. For example, when an issue type is changed from Story to Epic via the *Edit Issue* screen, the *Epic Name* field is not displayed in the screen even though it is a mandatory field for Epics. As a result, the issue is converted from a Story to an Epic without having any *Epic Name* set.
Similar issue described in JRASERVER-36946
fields.summary: Required fields are not set when issue type is changed by inline edit.
Add Heading/Clarification to Project Details Documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36161].
  {panel}

I have following feature request based on experiences in our company:

As an issue evolves, more and more information will collect about (a) important steps reached, (b) the content of messages sent back and forth between customer and developer and (c) results of internal discussions, to name just a few.

In order to quickly see the history and current state of an issue it would be nice to have a "protocol field" which basically is a table of date, user and protocol entry, sortable ascending or decscending by date. The content of such protocol would be for example:
(with PO being the product owner, DEV being a specific developer)

2012-01-13 | PO | Feature request received via phone by customer X
2012-01-28 | PO |  Mail PO->customer: We need a workshop.
2012-01-28 | PO | Internal discussion with DEV and  .... for creating offer
2012-03-28 | PO | Customer says this is urgent, needs offer until ....
2012-03-30 | PO | Workshop held with customer, results see Confluence page XYZ
2012-04-05 | PO | Grooming finished
2012-04-08 | PO | Offer sent, specification see Confuence page  XYZ2
2012-04-10 | PO | Customer accepts offer
2012-04-15 | DEV | Work started
2012-04-17 | DEV | Discussion with customer about detail of specification: Customer wants 4 instead of 3 colums in report.
2012-04-17 | PO | Change request accepted.
2012-04-27 | DEV2 | Internal test and review of code successful
2012-04-27 | DEV | Delivery to customer
2012-05-10 | PO | Mail to customer: Tests done already? Can we finish issue? Waiting for feedback.
2012-05-12 | DEV | Customer installed and tested product
2012-05-12 | PO | Invoice sent by mail to Mr XYZ

I think you get the picture.
There are several of  these entries which could be automatically created by JIRA, such as status changes (e.g, open->test->resolved), but often additional information is needed, such as about the content/result of a discussion or phone call.

We are aware that we could do all this using "comments", but given that comments are not exactly "compact", each being put into a separate box with header above, the rather compact protocol example given above wouldn't be as clear any more. This becomes especially a problem if comments also include detailed developer discussions, the complete content of mails sent etc.

Currently we have resorted to a long text field for entering the protocol. While generally suitable, this has following shortcomings:
- Anybody can edit protocol entries by any other person
- It can happen by accident, that parts or the complete field are emptied.
- People cannot agree on one common formatting
(- The list partly duplicates information shown in the JIRA issues' status change list)

Ideally it would be possible to add and manage protocol entries for an issue just the way comments are created and issues, but the protocol entries would appear in a compact list separate from the comments in a far more prominent location than at the end of the issue screen. Furthermore relevant status changes would automatically be added to the protocol by JIRA.
fields.summary: Have "protocol" field and / or functionality to quickly get an overview about current issue history.

fields.description:
Yesterday we upgraded our JIRA from 5.1.2 to 6.1.2, and now when we go to Clone an Issue no new issue is created. What is happening is if the 'Clone Attachments' option is selected the attachments will be duplicated on the existing issue we wanted to clone, and the clone link will be added, saying issue is cloned by issue, and they are the exact same number. 

We've tried it without the 'clone attachments' option and even on other issues and in other projects on our JIRA but with the same outcome. This is not a permission problem, as it is those with administrator power attempting this. Clone issue is simply not working.
fields.summary: Unable to Clone Issues after Upgrade
Error in log relating to Auditing
Add a plugin point for Issue Navigator views

Recently, I started getting errors when my users use Remote Copy. This error occurs after clicking Next in the "Copy Details" section. I found some Atlassian Answers that explain this has something to do with the cascading select, but I don't know what the issue actually IS. We did add new fields recently, including some cascading select. We have rebuilt our index since then. I am not clear what's actually WRONG with those fields. h3. Summary

When upgrading from JIRA < 6 to a later version, it has not updated the username in the Update Issue Post-Function from mixed-case to lower-case. Subsequently the transition fails as it cannot assign the issue to that user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Restore the problematic data that contains this scenario.
# Upgrade the instance.
# Attempt to transition the workflow.

h3. Expected Results

The issue successfully transitions through the workflow.

h3. Actual Results

The transition fails.

h3. Notes

Checking an XML export of the workflow we can see the value is not updated:

{code:html}
<arg name="field.value">CaptainPlanet</arg>
<arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueFieldFunction</arg>
<arg name="field.name">assignee</arg>
{code}

h3. Workaround

# Backup the instance to XML.
# Modify the XML backup to lower-case all the users in the workflows.
# Restore the XML.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36135].
{panel}
Since MySQL 5.5+, there is support for 4 byte characters. JIRA is capable of handling these characters when using other databases. Due to some limitations in how MySQL is implemented, JIRA won't just work by setting the 4 byte encoding utf8mb4. MySQL's InnoDB engine is limited to a maximum size of 767 bytes for any field used in an index, and there are various places in JIRA that use a VARCHAR(255) field in an index. This means that JIRA will encounter an error such as the below if you try to simply install into an utf8mb4 database:
{code:none}
2013-10-30 11:43:23,723 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE TABLE cwd_directory_attribute (directory_id DECIMAL(18,0) NOT NULL, attribute_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, attribute_value VARCHAR(255), CONSTRAINT PK_cwd_directory_attribute PRIMARY KEY (directory_id, attribute_name))
Error was: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Specified key was too long; max key length is 767 bytes
{code}
A full list of InnoDB restrictions including this one is listed at [http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/innodb-restrictions.html]

Now that MySQL 5.7 supports utf8mb4 better, the main restriction is actually that you need to set the server encoding and JDBC URL such that the connection uses the right encoding. This is documented in workaround 2 below.
h3. Workaround 1

You can switch to another of the databases supported by Jira like PostgreSQL following the guide [Switching database - Migrating JIRA's data to a different type of database server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/switching-databases-802592192.html#Switchingdatabases-differenttype]. If you are having problems parsing the XML backup, then you could process the data manually and remove any 4 byte characters before importing to avoid the problem. If difficulties persist, you can reach out to Atlassian Support for assistance or to the Atlassian community.
h3. Workaround 2

Upgrade to JIRA 7.3 or later versions which MySQL 5.7 is supported. MySQL 5.7.9 defaults the table row format to {{DYNAMIC}} which supports indexes longer than 767 bytes and it works well with {{utf8mb4}} collation. For more information, please refer to this KB article: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/emojis-and-special-characters-for-jira-with-mysql-952604493.html]
 * It is important to mention that this involves a configuration that is not supported and we cannot guarantee it will work for everyone and the reason to include it here is for users who have no choice but to use MySQL as their database to have an additional option.
fields.summary: Add support for 4 byte characters in MySQL connection

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to assign users in JIRA, they are assigned to the incorrect username and can no longer be found within the Issue Navigator. For example:

# Create an issue and assign it to user {{CAPTAIN.PLANET}}.
# It is actually assigned to {{captain.planet}}.
# Searching for {{assignee = 'CAPTAIN.PLANET'}} returns no results.

This appears to be caused by migrating off OnDemand onto 5.2.11 and then upgrading to a later version. 

{panel}
(!) This bug *only* affects instances that were exported from OnDemand into 5.2.11.
{panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Migrate from OnDemand to 5.2.11 (this is no longer possible due to upgrades in OnDemand).
# Upgrade JIRA from 5.2.11 to 6.x.

Any instances that were previously hosted in OnDemand that were restored into JIRA 5.2.11 BTF can be affected by this and reproduce the error upon upgrade.

h3. Expected Results

The upgrade proceeds flawlessly and the usernames in JIRA are correctly identified.

h3. Actual Results

Additional records are added to {{app_user}} and subsequently the usernames are of the incorrect case and searching no longer works.

h3. Notes

This can be verified by checking for records in the {{app_user}} table in 5.2.11:
{code:SQL}
SELECT * FROM app_user;
{code}

h3. Workaround

# Backup the 5.2.11 instance.
# Stop JIRA.
# Remove the {{app_user}} records:
{code:SQL}
DELETE FROM app_user;
{code}
# Start JIRA.
# Create an XML backup and upgrade the instance to the latest version using that backup. The {{app_user}} records will be correctly recreated.
fields.summary: Incorrect entries are created in app_user causing issues to be assigned to the incorrect username

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36107].
  {panel}

If you use Workflow Designer to create a new workflow, in "Diagram" mode you can select the "Create" transition and add a screen. 

Screens for creating issues are actually set in the 'Screen Scheme', in the 'Create' operation, not in the workflow. This allows the user to set 2 screens for creating issues, and the one in the workflow's transition is simply ignored.

h2. Steps to Reproduce
* Go to workflows and choose "Add Workflow"
* In Diagram mode, click on the Create transition
* Click Edit on the right and add a screen to the transition
** note that this is not an option in text mode

It does not seem to actually apply the screen in testing - when attempting to create an issue I am not seeing the associated transition screen.

h2. Workaround
# There is no workaround to remove the associated screen from designer view; you need to create a new workflow or copy an existing that does not have this screen associated.
# If you want to set a screen to the create operation, please do so in the respected [Screen Scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Associating+a+Screen+with+an+Issue+Operation]. Screen Schemes can be set to specific issue types within a project in [Issue Type Screen Schemes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Associating+Screen+and+Issue+Operation+Mappings+with+an+Issue+Type], like workflows.
fields.summary: Workflow Designer allows you to add screen to create transition

fields.description:
h4.Problem

See the table below:

{code}
ghs-9961=# select * from changeitem where groupid in (select id from changegroup where issueid in (69951))  and field in ('status', 'Project', 'Workflow')order by ID;
   id    | groupid | fieldtype |  field   | oldvalue |          oldstring          | newvalue |              newstring              
---------+---------+-----------+----------+----------+-----------------------------+----------+-------------------------------------
  125793 |  103861 | jira      | status   | 1        | Open                        | 10039    | Minor Platform Backlog
  457403 |  306252 | jira      | Project  | 10202    | Change Requests             | 10341    | Feature Request
  457405 |  306252 | jira      | Workflow | 75817    | xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx          | 148100   | Feature Request Workflow
 1777902 | 1168181 | jira      | Workflow | 148100   | Feature Request Workflow    | 336599   | Feature Request Workflow II
 2248090 | 1488772 | jira      | Workflow | 336599   | Feature Request Workflow II | 409602   | Copy of Feature Request Workflow II
 2248091 | 1488772 | jira      | status   | 10060    | Backlog                     | 10059    | Roadmap Control Board{code}

When the issue is migrated to the new project and workflow, the issue didn't transition correctly from the previous status "Minor Platform Backlog" to "Backlog". 

*Expected Behavior*

When the issue migrated to new project and workflow, it is expected to have transition from the previous status (ie. Minor Platform Backlog) to the new status (ie. Backlog). 

*Problem*

The missing transition breaks some chart reporting in JIRA Agile which highly depends on the *changeitem* (issue history).

(!) *So far support unable to reproduce this behavior. This indicates this behavior is triggered by very specific and rare condition. This bug is to keep track if there is more users affected by this problem and found the explicit way to reproduce this.*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36102].
  {panel}

h3. Symptoms

Below features are not usable/accessible after restoring JIRA OnDemand backup into standalone:
* JIRA standard footer - disabled
* FishEye Configuration - add-on disabled
* Perforce Job Integration - add-on disabled
* JIRA User Server - menu disabled (see JRA-35165)
* Atlassian Support Tools - add-on disabled
* Jelly runner - add-on disabled

h3. Cause

Data from {{pluginstate}} table from JIRA OnDemand brought over into generated backup files. Check attached [file|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/105758/ondemand_pluginstate.txt] for the list.

h3. Workaround

# After backup data imported, stop JIRA
# Access JIRA database
# Empty {{pluginstate}} table with below queries:
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM pluginstate;
{code}
(!) Remember to create a database backup and check if the SQL query above compatible with your database type.
# Start JIRA
fields.summary: Some features missing after restoring JIRA OnDemand backup to standalone

fields.description:
Hi,

As per attached "wasfater.png" the ''after" predicate should correctly evaluate a date in the format "yyyy/mm/dd".

Refer to the 2 attached examples (A example and B example) where both the following scripts below return the same number of records. 

a)	project = PSP AND issuetype = "Change Control Request" AND resolution was "Completed" after "2013/10/17" and "Change Sponsor" = bkhumalo and status was in ("UAT In Progress")

b)	project = PSP AND issuetype = "Change Control Request" AND resolution was "Completed" after "2013/12/31" and "Change Sponsor" = bkhumalo and status was in ("UAT In Progress")

b) above is incorrect as there are no records yet with a completed resolution after "2013/12/31", this is a future date.

The fix was then to add and evaluate against the resolutiondate as below:

project = PSP AND issuetype = "Change Control Request" AND resolution was "Completed" AND resolutiondate >= "2013/10/17" and "Change Sponsor" = bkhumalo and status was in ("UAT In Progress")
fields.summary: JQL Operator predicates not picking up the correct dates- seems as if dates are not been evaluated correctly.

When working in a global environment, communicating times back and forth can be challenging some times since it requires constant time zone conversion.

A tool which could convert times in text fields to the local time zone of the user looking at it, could be very worth full.

ie.
I (GMT+1) am trying to set up a screen share with another user in another time zone (GMT+5). 
When I add a tag to my suggested time, JIRA will automatically convert this to the local time of which ever user looks at it. In this case, I would write {tag}13:00{tag} which for the other user would get displayed as "17:00"
fields.summary: Time zone conversion tool

fields.description:
If you change the format of the year from two digits to four under date/time format and in advance settings, whenever work is logged, JIRA only retains the last two numbers in the year timestamp in the issue. Afterwards, JIRA renders the wrong date in the work log. See screenshots.

Step 1 - Select log work from an issue.
Step 2 - Log work shows correct four digit year format. Use the picker to change the date to another day.
Step 3 - Notice that the year four digit format changed to a two digit format.
Step 4 - JIRA  renders '0013' instead of '2013' in the work log.

Settings are shown in screenshot 'Settings1' and 'Settings2'. Tested in OnDemand.
fields.summary: Four digit year time format doesn't translate with logging work

fields.description:
If an existing workflow transition is associated with a screen, you cannot change this to 'None' via the diagram mode.  This affects both active and inactive workflows.

Steps to reproduce for inactive workflow:
* Edit an existing workflow with a transition that has a screen
* Edit the transition and change the screen to none
!Set_transition_screen_to_None.jpg|thumbnail!
* Save and Confirm
!Confirm_screen_is_None.jpg|thumbnail!
* At this point it should be saved, but if you refresh the page, the settings are reverted
!Refresh_page_-_Screen_is_back.jpg|thumbnail!
* Note this was for an inactive workflow and does not need to be published
* If this was an active workflow, hitting *Publish* will refresh the page and the same result: the transition screen reverts back to the original setting
* This only occurs when trying to switch from an existing screen to *None*.  Switching to another screen works fine

h3. Workaround
Use the Workflow editor *Text* mode to remove the transition screen
fields.summary: Workflow Diagram cannot set Transition Screen to None

h3. Summary
When performed in a certain way (the replication steps is below), the menu where new issues are created uses the attachment from the previous created issue.

h3. Steps to replicate 
# Create an issue with the Create Issue popup disabled
# In this new issue, include an attachment
# In the newly created issue, try to create an issue clicking the Create Issue button
# Scroll down the page, and in the attachments section, the attachment from the previous created issue will already be attached

h3. Other facts

* This was tested in JIRA 6.0.8 and 6.1.4. Both versions are affected
fields.summary: Create issue carries over attachment from previous issue when the Create Issue popup is disabled

h3. Since [JRA-6113|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-6113] is a very old ticket which has already been closed, we are opening a new case since this feature is affecting more customers and products everyday (Service Desk for example).

h3. Current behaviour:
It's possible to specify comment security level in JIRA per group or per roles. On the other hand, when you receive a notification from this ticket, you don't have the possibility to use the same security level or to set a new one via e-mail, and the response is always send with no comment restriction.

h3. Expected behaviour:
We want either to keep the same security level of the notification (i.e: If the comment was sent as "Restricted to developers", the mail notification response should use this same restriction level) or to have the possibility to set the security level in the notification.
fields.summary: Comment security level should be set in mail response

fields.description:
Here are the steps to reproduce the issue : 
1) Rename user in LDAP
2) Sync the directory in Crowd(version 2.7). Verified that user rename is correct and groups also correct.
3) Sync the directory in JIRA. The old username remains as the old one. 
4) When the renamed user tries to sign in to JIRA, neither the new or old user name can login.

*Workaround :* 
# Navigate to the Crowd user directory in JIRA 
# Click 'Edit'
# Uncheck the field : 'Enable Incremental Synchronisation'
# This would force JIRA to do full synchronisation
# Now synchronise the Crowd directory in JIRA
# The usernames should be updated at the end of synchronisation
fields.summary: Rename users in Crowd does not rename users in JIRA via Incremental Synchronisation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36064].
  {panel}

Hi,

We are currently using issue collectors in one of our projects. Recently we've noticed that the attachments added through the issue collector have the wrong name, they should be <file-name> but they are displayed as <full system path>/<file-name> see : 
!attachment-fail.jpg!

This causes the attachments to be available (it simply points to an error page or an empty file if you click on the attachment).

Steps to reproduce :
# go to a test project in JIRA
# create an issue collector containing the possibility to upload attachments and with a default reporter filled in.
# paste this issue collector in a test HTML page 
# open this test page in a new browser (one which you haven't yet used today)
# open the issue collector and add a new issue with an attachment.
# click submit
# go back to your other browser and the Jira project
# find the newly create issue and see the attachment failure.
fields.summary: Attachments in Issue Collectors are broken if the browser doesn't have an Atlassian Session open.

fields.description:
Internet Explorer 10 or IE10 will show a blank page when trying to access a URL with i#browse.

IE8/9 will have the i#browse in its URL when using the quick search for issues. When sharing the URL (instead of the Share feature in JIRA), IE10 users will face problems trying to load the link and will have to manually remove the i# from the URL to get the page to load.

Tested on JIRA 6.1.4.

Example of a broken URL in IE10:
{code}http://localhost:8080/i#browse/DEMO-1{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce 
# Open IE8/9 and enter an issue key in quicksearch. This will take you to the view issue page and you'll end up wiht a URL like http://localhost:8080/i#browse/DEMO-1
# Then copy this URL and paste it into IE10. You'll get a JS error and a blank page.

h3. Non affected browser
* Chrome 31
* Firefox 25
* IE11
fields.summary: IE10 could not access the URL with i#browse

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36048].
  {panel}

At this moment it only seems to be possible to deploy to the default server instance (the DAS) of a particular Glassfish domain.

In reality it is often necessary to deploy the application to a separate server instance, and not the default DAS instance.

This implies the need to not only create, start, and stop a domain, but also the need to be able to:
create a node agent.
start a node agent.
stop a node agent.
create a server instance.
start a server instance.
stop a server instance.
deploy an application to a particular server instance.

The above functionality would drastically increase productivity and the means to check in an early fase whether the domain-nodeagent-sever instance setup is correct.

Kind regards,
EDH
fields.summary: Deployment to Glassfish server instances
